container.heading: Inactive Status and Reinstatement of Expired Licenses

section.heading: Inactive Status.
section.text: The Board shall place a license on inactive status, if the licensee submits to the Board:

para.text: An application for inactive status on the form required by the Board; and
The inactive status fee required by COMAR 10.28.07.

section.heading: Application for Active Licensure by Optometrist on Inactive Status.
section.text: An optometrist who is on inactive status may apply for reinstatement of active licensure. The Board shall issue an active license if the optometrist:

para.text: Submits to the Board satisfactory proof of completion of continuing education hours required of a practitioner on active status during the period of inactivity, not to exceed 125 hours; and
Pays to the Board the reinstatement fee required by COMAR 10.28.07.

Any optometrist whose license has been expired for less than 5 years and who has not been put on inactive status may apply for reinstatement of their license. The Board may reinstate the license if the optometrist:

Submits to the Board satisfactory proof of having subsequently met the continuing education requirements required of a practitioner on active status during the period the license was expired, not to exceed 125 hours;
Otherwise meets the renewal requirements set forth in Health Occupations Article, §11-308, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
Pays to the Board the fee for the same number of renewal cycles lapsed plus $50.

The Board may reinstate the license of any optometrist whose license has been expired for 5 years or more and who has not been put on inactive status, or practiced optometry, only if the optometrist passes an examination recognized by the Board.
